Art. 4.168. 
Present property 
A gift may only include the donor's present property. If it includes future property, it is void as regards that property.

Art. 4.169. 
Conditions of the gift 
Any gift made subject to conditions whose performance depends solely on the will of the donor is void.
It is likewise void if it has been made subject to the condition of discharging debts or liabilities other than those which existed at the time of the gift, or which would be expressed either in the deed of gift or in the statement to be inserted therein or annexed thereto.
If the donor has reserved the right to dispose of any property included in the gift, or of a fixed sum out of the property given, and if he dies without having disposed of it, the said property or the said sum shall belong to the donor's heirs, notwithstanding any clause to the contrary.
